text.content:
You can use certain text enriching codes in item descriptions to obtain inline attribute or luck calls ("The target must roll @[agi]") or inline rolls ("On a failure, it takes @[1d6|d] damage").

Other than being formatted, they do nothing outside of Chat Messages.

Attribute or Luck Call

You can use inline attribute calls to request an attribute or luck roll from whoever clicks it.

Syntax

@[attr], @[attr+boons], @[attr-banes]

  • attr is the called attribute's key. Possible keys are:

    • str: Strength

    • agi: Agility

    • int: Intellect

    • wil: Will

    • luck: Luck

  • Optional: +boons indicates that the roll is made with a number of boons: +1, +2, +3.

  • Optional: -banes indicates that the roll is made with a number of banes: -1, -2, -3.

Examples

  • @[str]: @[str]

  • @[agi+2]: @[agi+2] (with 2 boons)

  • @[wil-1]: @[wil-1] (with 1 bane)

Inline Roll

You can also use inline rolls to conveniently allow people to roll a dice expression.

Syntax

@[exp], @[exp|type]

  • exp is the the dice expression to be rolled: 1d6, 2d6+1, 1d6+3d6.

  • Optional, but Recommended: type is the roll type key. Possible keys are:

    • d: Damage

    • h: Healing

    • hl: Health Loss

    • hr: Health Recovery

Examples

  • @[1d6]: @[1d6] (unspecified)

  • @[1d6+2|d]: @[1d6+2|d] (flagged as a damage roll)

  • @[2d6|hl]: @[2d6|hl] (flagged as a Health loss roll)
